basics.name: Sixian Du
basics.label: Scientist
basics.summary: A China-born theoretical physicist, widely ranked among the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

location.address: School of Healthcare Management, Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology

work.name: School of Healthcare Management, Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology
work.summary: Studying for a bachelor's or master's degree, with a focus on primary healthcare services and health economics.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter K√∂rper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson‚ÄìMorley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: √úber einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativit√§tstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909‚Äì1911) and Prague (1911‚Äì1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912‚Äì1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
